lead_paragraph: But a team of legal advisers did not rule out the possibility of graft because it was unable to establish who ultimately received a suspicious payment, a report said.

headline.print_headline: Inquiry Finds No Vote-Buying in ’06 World Cup
headline.main: Inquiry Into Germany’s 2006 World Cup Bid Finds No Indication of Vote Buying

snippet: But a team of legal advisers did not rule out the possibility of graft because it was unable to establish who ultimately received a suspicious payment, a report said.
abstract: Freshfields Bruckhaus Deringer, concluding its independent investigation, finds no proof of vote-buying in relation to Germany's successful bid to host 2006 World Cup; cautions that corruption can still not be ruled out, given failure to discover fate of suspicious payment that prompted inquiry.
